Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

中国移动杭研火热招聘中China Mobile Hangzhou Research Institute is hiring vigorously.China Mobile Hangzhou R&D Center, also known as China Mobile (Hangzhou) Information Technology Co., Ltd., is a direct R&D institution and wholly-owned subsidiary of China Mobile, with an initial registered capital of 600 million RMB. This is an important layout for China Mobile to explore the new idea of centralized operation in the R&D field, and also an important platform for China Mobile to further gather R&D strength, accelerate the application and industrialization process of R&D achievements, and promote the collaborative innovation and development of new generation network transmission, network equipment manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

The call to arms!!! hashtag#EngineeringSurveyingEspisode 3 How many hashtag#EngineeringSurveying hashtag#Apprentices are you employing this year and future years to deliver your hashtag#CivilEngineering hashtag#Projects ????The journey continues increasing numbers of hashtag#EngineeringSurveyors in the industry. Today was the L3 and L6 Geospatial Apprenticeship Trailblazer Group Meeting hosted by Lucy Powers BA (Hons), MBA, FInstCES and Alison Watson MBE. I was invited to present what we Balfour Beatty plc are doing to attract future hashtag#Apprentices in to hashtag#BalfourBeatty. The slide which got the most discussion was the second image attached. The pathway to be a recognised professional. This shows not only the education pathway but also the pathway to Member status with the hashtag#CICES and building letters behind your name whilst working.Colleges and Universities need the numbers to be able to run Level 3 Engineering Surveying Course across the country at hashtag#crontoncollege hashtag#dudleycollege hashtag#newsuffolkcollege and hashtag#T3We in hashtag#balfourbeatty have committed to 12 Level 3 Engineering Surveying Apprenticeships to join these colleges in September 2025. Also you dont have to just be on an Engineering Surveying career path - our hashtag#ProjectInformationManagement hashtag#BuildingInformationManagement hashtag#BIM hashtag#GIS apprentices can also join the Level 3 Geospatial Survey Technicain Apprenticeship as well to have a formal education whilst working. So the question is how many are all other hashtag#contractors hashtag#EngineeringSurveying hashtag#Practices hashtag#DesignConsultants hashtag#SupplyPartners going to add to our number to make sure these courses run in 2025 and future years????? hashtag#MakeSpaceforEducation hashtag#BelikeBalfourBeatty hashtag#buildyour hashtag#EngineeringSurveying numbers in 2025 and beyond Thank you to my fellow Balfour Beatty colleagues for getting apprentices approved on their projects Dave Davis Nigel Evans FCInstCES MIMMM Alexander Thurgood Alex Grounds Graeme Ross MCinstCES James Rolland Andy Murphy. But let's not stop at 12...FYI hashtag#TheJourneyContinuesStuart Graham Kevin Webber Millie Bullock Daisy Hughes Eileen Longworth BSC (hons) FCICES Andrew Dodsworth

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

中国移动杭研火热招聘中China Mobile Hangzhou Research Institute is hiring vigorously.China Mobile Hangzhou R&D Center, also known as China Mobile (Hangzhou) Information Technology Co., Ltd., is a direct R&D institution and wholly-owned subsidiary of China Mobile, with an initial registered capital of 600 million RMB. In order to stay at the forefront of technological innovation, constantly adapt to the new competitive environment of the modern market, and continuously improve the core competitiveness of the enterprise, China Mobile established the Hangzhou R&D Center in Hangzhou Future Science and Technology City on March 4, 2014. This is an important layout for China Mobile to explore the new idea of centralized operation in the R&D field, and also an important platform for China Mobile to further gather R&D strength, accelerate the application and industrialization process of R&D achievements, and promote the collaborative innovation and development of new generation network transmission, network equipment manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. Oh, and fresh graduates welcome!”Translation: We have no idea what we want, but we’ll still act like we do.📢 Step 2: The Too-Good-To-Be-True Salary"Salary: Competitive."Translation: You’ll find out at the last stage… or never.📢 Step 3: The Interview ProcessRound 1: A quick call filled with enthusiasm. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Kindly share your CV and WhatsApp number."Bonus Points: If the company name doesn’t exist on Google. 😆To all the real recruiters out there doing an honest job, we salute you! 🫡 But to the fake ones – we see you, and we’re taking screenshots. 😏Tag a friend who's been ghosted or scammed by a fake recruiter! 😂👇hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#JobHunt hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobSeeker hashtag#WorkLife hashtag#LinkedInHumor hashtag#HiringNow hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WorkFromHome hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#HRLife hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#LinkedInNetworking hashtag#FakeJobs hashtag#CareerTips hashtag#InterviewFail hashtag#JobHuntingStruggles hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#ProfessionalGrowth hashtag#LinkedInCommunity hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobInterview hashtag#GhostedByRecruiters hashtag#JobMarket hashtag#ResumeHelp hashtag#CareerMotivation hashtag#WorkplaceHumor hashtag#JobSearchStruggles hashtag#RecruiterFails hashtag#JobScams hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#JobSeekerJourney hashtag#WorkHardPlayHard hashtag#OfficeHumor hashtag#LinkedInMarketing hashtag#JobOffers hashtag#CorporateHumor hashtag#CareerOppo hashtag#letsconnect

Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. Oh, and fresh graduates welcome!”Translation: We have no idea what we want, but we’ll still act like we do.📢 Step 2: The Too-Good-To-Be-True Salary"Salary: Competitive."Translation: You’ll find out at the last stage… or never.📢 Step 3: The Interview ProcessRound 1: A quick call filled with enthusiasm. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Kindly share your CV and WhatsApp number."Bonus Points: If the company name doesn’t exist on Google. 😆To all the real recruiters out there doing an honest job, we salute you! 🫡 But to the fake ones – we see you, and we’re taking screenshots. 😏Tag a friend who's been ghosted or scammed by a fake recruiter! 😂👇hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#JobHunt hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobSeeker hashtag#WorkLife hashtag#LinkedInHumor hashtag#HiringNow hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WorkFromHome hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#HRLife hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#LinkedInNetworking hashtag#FakeJobs hashtag#CareerTips hashtag#InterviewFail hashtag#JobHuntingStruggles hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#ProfessionalGrowth hashtag#LinkedInCommunity hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobInterview hashtag#GhostedByRecruiters hashtag#JobMarket hashtag#ResumeHelp hashtag#CareerMotivation hashtag#WorkplaceHumor hashtag#JobSearchStruggles hashtag#RecruiterFails hashtag#JobScams hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#JobSeekerJourney hashtag#WorkHardPlayHard hashtag#OfficeHumor hashtag#LinkedInMarketing hashtag#JobOffers hashtag#CorporateHumor hashtag#CareerOppo hashtag#letsconnect

Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

accelerate the application and industrialization process of R&D achievements, and promote the collaborative innovation and development of new generation network transmission, network equipment manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. Oh, and fresh graduates welcome!”Translation: We have no idea what we want, but we’ll still act like we do.📢 Step 2: The Too-Good-To-Be-True Salary"Salary: Competitive."Translation: You’ll find out at the last stage… or never.📢 Step 3: The Interview ProcessRound 1: A quick call filled with enthusiasm. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Kindly share your CV and WhatsApp number."Bonus Points: If the company name doesn’t exist on Google. 😆To all the real recruiters out there doing an honest job, we salute you! 🫡 But to the fake ones – we see you, and we’re taking screenshots. 😏Tag a friend who's been ghosted or scammed by a fake recruiter! 😂👇hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#JobHunt hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobSeeker hashtag#WorkLife hashtag#LinkedInHumor hashtag#HiringNow hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WorkFromHome hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#HRLife hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#LinkedInNetworking hashtag#FakeJobs hashtag#CareerTips hashtag#InterviewFail hashtag#JobHuntingStruggles hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#ProfessionalGrowth hashtag#LinkedInCommunity hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobInterview hashtag#GhostedByRecruiters hashtag#JobMarket hashtag#ResumeHelp hashtag#CareerMotivation hashtag#WorkplaceHumor hashtag#JobSearchStruggles hashtag#RecruiterFails hashtag#JobScams hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#JobSeekerJourney hashtag#WorkHardPlayHard hashtag#OfficeHumor hashtag#LinkedInMarketing hashtag#JobOffers hashtag#CorporateHumor hashtag#CareerOppo hashtag#letsconnect

Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. Oh, and fresh graduates welcome!”Translation: We have no idea what we want, but we’ll still act like we do.📢 Step 2: The Too-Good-To-Be-True Salary"Salary: Competitive."Translation: You’ll find out at the last stage… or never.📢 Step 3: The Interview ProcessRound 1: A quick call filled with enthusiasm. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. Oh, and fresh graduates welcome!”Translation: We have no idea what we want, but we’ll still act like we do.📢 Step 2: The Too-Good-To-Be-True Salary"Salary: Competitive."Translation: You’ll find out at the last stage… or never.📢 Step 3: The Interview ProcessRound 1: A quick call filled with enthusiasm. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

中国移动杭研火热招聘中China Mobile Hangzhou Research Institute is hiring vigorously.China Mobile Hangzhou R&D Center, also known as China Mobile (Hangzhou) Information Technology Co., Ltd., is a direct R&D institution and wholly-owned subsidiary of China Mobile, with an initial registered capital of 600 million RMB. accelerate the application and industrialization process of R&D achievements, and promote the collaborative innovation and development of new generation network transmission, network equipment manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce

It’s time companies started seeing autistic people as assets, not obstacles!This is the first time I’m openly admitting that I’m autistic (Asperger) beyond my close family and friends. It’s something I’ve kept to myself for a long time because, frankly, it’s not easy. Every word you say can make you feel like an outsider, as if people see you as “weird.” So, the instinct is to hide it, to avoid declaring it, and to struggle against the pressure to conform.But my brother—who works in education and supports people with autism, dyslexia, and other neurodivergences—recently said something that really stuck with me: Autism isn’t a hindrance; it’s a superpower! I was genuinely touched because, honestly, I often worry that he doesn’t see me that way.For example, when I approach a problem, I see the big picture, while many “neurotypical” people focus only on what’s right in front of them. This ability is especially valuable in programming, where structure, logic, and attention to detail are essential. Autistic people often excel in programming and technical fields because of their ability to spot patterns, think systematically, and work with incredible focus.But what’s frustrating is when others can’t see the big picture and block progress because they’re stuck on minor details or rigid ways of thinking. It’s exhausting to have a clear vision of how things should work, only to be told, “That’s not how we do it,” by people who refuse to see beyond their own limited perspective. This is one of the biggest challenges autistic people face in the workplace—not our abilities, but the barriers put in our way by those who don’t understand them.Some companies fail to see the value in this. But the best ones do, and they recognise the incredible strengths that autistic minds bring.This conversation has really lifted my spirits. I love seeing more people acknowledge that autistic individuals have so much to offer when given the right environment to thrive—especially in fields like programming, where our strengths shine!Well done Murphy for setting a new standard!

The call to arms!!! hashtag#EngineeringSurveyingEspisode 3 How many hashtag#EngineeringSurveying hashtag#Apprentices are you employing this year and future years to deliver your hashtag#CivilEngineering hashtag#Projects ????The journey continues increasing numbers of hashtag#EngineeringSurveyors in the industry. Today was the L3 and L6 Geospatial Apprenticeship Trailblazer Group Meeting hosted by Lucy Powers BA (Hons), MBA, FInstCES and Alison Watson MBE. I was invited to present what we Balfour Beatty plc are doing to attract future hashtag#Apprentices in to hashtag#BalfourBeatty. The slide which got the most discussion was the second image attached. The pathway to be a recognised professional. This shows not only the education pathway but also the pathway to Member status with the hashtag#CICES and building letters behind your name whilst working.Colleges and Universities need the numbers to be able to run Level 3 Engineering Surveying Course across the country at hashtag#crontoncollege hashtag#dudleycollege hashtag#newsuffolkcollege and hashtag#T3We in hashtag#balfourbeatty have committed to 12 Level 3 Engineering Surveying Apprenticeships to join these colleges in September 2025. Also you dont have to just be on an Engineering Surveying career path - our hashtag#ProjectInformationManagement hashtag#BuildingInformationManagement hashtag#BIM hashtag#GIS apprentices can also join the Level 3 Geospatial Survey Technicain Apprenticeship as well to have a formal education whilst working. So the question is how many are all other hashtag#contractors hashtag#EngineeringSurveying hashtag#Practices hashtag#DesignConsultants hashtag#SupplyPartners going to add to our number to make sure these courses run in 2025 and future years????? hashtag#MakeSpaceforEducation hashtag#BelikeBalfourBeatty hashtag#buildyour hashtag#EngineeringSurveying numbers in 2025 and beyond Thank you to my fellow Balfour Beatty colleagues for getting apprentices approved on their projects Dave Davis Nigel Evans FCInstCES MIMMM Alexander Thurgood Alex Grounds Graeme Ross MCinstCES James Rolland Andy Murphy. But let's not stop at 12...FYI hashtag#TheJourneyContinuesStuart Graham Kevin Webber Millie Bullock Daisy Hughes Eileen Longworth BSC (hons) FCICES Andrew Dodsworth

**Hiring the wrong tech talent can sink your startup before you even scale. 🚨**Founders, I get it—you’re racing to build your dream team. But in the rush, these mistakes can cost you time, money, and culture. Here’s what to avoid:✅ **Hiring for skills alone**A brilliant coder who clashes with your culture? Toxic. Skills matter, but fit is everything.🔹 **Ignoring soft skills**Tech teams need collaborators, not lone wolves. Communication > raw talent when scaling.💡 **Overlooking adaptability**Early-stage chaos demands problem-solvers, not just specialists. Look for learners, not know-it-alls.🚀 **Waiting for the "perfect" hire**Speed beats perfection in startups. Hire for potential, then grow together.The best teams aren’t built overnight—they’re nurtured.Which hiring lesson hit hardest for you? Let’s chat in the comments. 👇– Hassan from Berlin 🇩🇪Keep pushing boundaries 🚀

accelerate the application and industrialization process of R&D achievements, and promote the collaborative innovation and development of new generation network transmission, network equipment manufacturing, mobile terminal support, software and services and other information technologies.AI算法专家工作职责 1、负责云电脑AI大模型的设计、开发、训练和调优工作，包括但不限于大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）、计算机视觉（CV）等领域的模型架构设计，提升模型的性能、准确性和效率，以满足不同业务场景下的应用需求。2、跟踪国内外AI大模型领域的前沿技术动态，探索新的技术方向和应用场景，推动公司在AI大模型技术方面的创新突破，为公司产品和服务提供核心竞争力。3、参与公司AI大模型相关项目的规划、实施和管理，确保项目按时、高质量完成。与产品、运营、市场等人员紧密合作，将AI大模型技术成功应用于实际业务中，实现商业价值的最大化。4、为团队成员提供技术指导和培训，帮助团队提升技术水平和创新能力。带领团队攻克技术难题，营造良好的技术氛围和团队协作环境，促进团队整体技术能力的提升。5、撰写和维护AI大模型相关的技术文档、研究报告和专利申请，及时总结和分享技术经验和成果，为公司的技术积累和知识产权保护做出贡献。  任职资格 1、计算机科学、软件工程、人工智能等相关专业的硕士及以上学历；2、5年以上大模型相关工作经验，精通深度学习框架（如TensorFlow、PyTorch等），能够熟练使用这些框架进行模型开发和训练，对其内部原理有深入的理解，熟悉框架中的各种模块和功能，能够根据项目需求灵活选择和配置框架参数，以达到最优的模型性能；3、熟悉大语言模型（LLM）、自然语言处理（NLP）和计算机视觉（CV）领域的经典算法和模型，如Transformer架构、BERT、GPT系列、YOLO等，并有实际应用经验；4、具备扎实的编程能力，熟练掌握Python、C++等编程语言，能够高效地实现复杂的算法和模型；5、具备扎实的数学和统计学基础，包括线性代数、微积分、概率论和数理统计等。能够运用这些数学工具理解和推导机器学习和深度学习算法的数学原理，为模型的设计、训练和优化提供理论支持；7、在顶级会议（如ICLR, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, EMNLP, AAAI）上发表论文三篇及以上者优先；算法研发专家工作职责 1.技术规划：负责Wi-Fi、新型无线短距、空间定位等前瞻性无线感知定位技术方向研究，并制定技术规划路线与落地产品应用；2.技术攻坚：承担重大科研项目任务，负责算法的工程化工作，与嵌入式软件团队协作实现相关算法集成和工程化部署，并支撑在实际业务场景中的算法迭代优化；3.人才培养：负责团队在算法领域的技术成长建设，带领团队产出原创性、前沿性和具有行业影响力的成果；  任职资格 1.专业背景：计算机、模式识别、通信、数学等相关专业，硕士及以上学历，5年以上工作经验；2.技术能力：具有扎实的数学基础和编程能力、丰富的算法与嵌入式产品开发项目经验、产品需求分析与转化落地能力，至少熟练掌握C/C++，Python，Matlab其中两门语言，具备扎实的编程基础，熟悉常用的信号处理算法，主流模式识别、机器学习、深度学习等框架，如EKF滤波、目标识别、Pytorch等；3.项目经历：精通算法和网络技术，对6G/WLAN通信网络、通感算等相关领域有落地实践经验，熟悉关键落地要点，有自身独特的见解，熟悉Wi-Fi、UWB、雷达等主流传感器工作原理，有AI与雷达信号处理、无线感知结合研究或开发经验者优先；高级数据研发专家工作职责 1、负责团队大数据平台的架构设计与技术选型，构建稳定、高效、可扩展的实时/离线分布式计算框架；2、建立标准化大数据处理流程，包括但不限于数据采集、数据清洗、数据转换、数据存储等；3、深挖业务数据价值，负责业务大模型算法的设计、开发与优化。并完成数据模型在产品中落地应用，推动业务创新与发展；4、负责团队大数据能力赋能，提升团队在大数据应用方面的专业技能和创新能力。  任职资格 1、全日制博士学历及以上，计算机、通信、数学等相关专业，5年及以上数据科学或大模型领域工作经验；2、熟练掌握 Python、Java、Scala等至少一种主流编程语言，具备良好的编程习惯与代码规范，能够高效地进行数据处理、模型开发与算法实现；3、掌握 Hadoop、Spark、Flink 等大数据框架的运用且拥有大流量、高并发系统实战经历，能有效处理海量数据并保障系统在高压力下稳定高效运行；4、熟悉TensorFlow、PyTorch等至少一种深度学习框架 ，能高效完成模型的全流程开发与优化。

🚨 Dear Fake Recruiters, We See You! 🚨Hey there, legendary "recruiters" of LinkedIn! You know who you are – the ones offering dream jobs with “amazing opportunities” but somehow… things never quite add up. Let’s break down your hiring process, shall we? 😂📢 Step 1: The Perfect Job Post“We’re looking for a highly motivated, dynamic, results-driven individual who can work under pressure, multitask, lead a team, work independently, and also be a team player. Oh, and fresh graduates welcome!”Translation: We have no idea what we want, but we’ll still act like we do.📢 Step 2: The Too-Good-To-Be-True Salary"Salary: Competitive."Translation: You’ll find out at the last stage… or never.📢 Step 3: The Interview ProcessRound 1: A quick call filled with enthusiasm. "You’re the PERFECT fit for this role!"Round 2: A panel interview where no one from the company seems to know who you are.Round 3: A surprise "assignment" requiring 20 hours of unpaid labor.Final Round: Complete silence. Poof! You’ve been ghosted. 👻📢 Step 4: The Random DM Recruiter"Hello dear, I saw your profile and I have a great opportunity for you. Kindly share your CV and WhatsApp number."Bonus Points: If the company name doesn’t exist on Google. 😆To all the real recruiters out there doing an honest job, we salute you! 🫡 But to the fake ones – we see you, and we’re taking screenshots. 😏Tag a friend who's been ghosted or scammed by a fake recruiter! 😂👇hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#JobHunt hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobSeeker hashtag#WorkLife hashtag#LinkedInHumor hashtag#HiringNow hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WorkFromHome hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#HRLife hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#LinkedInNetworking hashtag#FakeJobs hashtag#CareerTips hashtag#InterviewFail hashtag#JobHuntingStruggles hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#ProfessionalGrowth hashtag#LinkedInCommunity hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobInterview hashtag#GhostedByRecruiters hashtag#JobMarket hashtag#ResumeHelp hashtag#CareerMotivation hashtag#WorkplaceHumor hashtag#JobSearchStruggles hashtag#RecruiterFails hashtag#JobScams hashtag#ScamAlert hashtag#JobSeekerJourney hashtag#WorkHardPlayHard hashtag#OfficeHumor hashtag#LinkedInMarketing hashtag#JobOffers hashtag#CorporateHumor hashtag#CareerOppo hashtag#letsconnect

Where my number crunchers at [respectfully]? 🧮

One of the things I’m most passionate about in my career is helping both companies and candidates find that ideal fit. It’s more than just matching a resume to a job description it’s about ensuring both parties find a long-term, fulfilling relationship that supports their growth.But let’s be real, recruiting can be tough. It's not always glamorous, and yes, the phrase "hard work" can often sound cliche. But for me, hard work isn’t just about putting in long hours it’s about doing the things that others may not want to do. It’s about adjusting your interview time to connect with that elusive candidate or diving deep into understanding every detail of a client’s needs to ensure the perfect match.In the past, I was the sole recruiter for 30+ locations, and I can honestly say that experience taught me what it truly takes to get the job done. When I say I know what it takes, I’m speaking from firsthand experience. It’s about juggling multiple priorities, thinking outside the box, and going the extra mile to find the right talent, even when the odds seem stacked against you.What I love most about this field is the ability to paint a vision to show all the possibilities that open up when the right opportunity meets the right person. It’s about connecting the dots, understanding the big picture, and guiding both sides toward something greater than they imagined.And let’s be honest, even when I want to shut off, I can’t. I’m constantly thinking of new ways to improve, new strategies to better serve my clients, and new avenues to take my work to the next level. I’m a firm believer in self-improvement and never stop striving to be better.So as we move into 2025, I’ll continue to give my all, pushing myself to go further, and helping others find the path that truly works for them. There’s nothing more fulfilling than making a difference and that’s what keeps me motivated every single day.Because 2025, it's my turn.For those of you following me, please stay tuned I promise you, it’s about to get interesting!hashtag#Recruiting hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#HardWork hashtag#SelfImprovement hashtag#PassionForPeople hashtag#JobMatching hashtag#2025Goals hashtag#ExperienceMatters hashtag#SkillDirect hashtag#SkillForce
